abstract: Short-sellers have challenged Diamond Foods’ accounting over a payment for walnuts. A subsequent drop in the company’s stock has cast a shadow over a deal to acquire Pringles from Procter & Gamble.
snippet: Short-sellers have challenged Diamond Foods’ accounting over a payment for walnuts. A subsequent drop in the company’s stock has cast a shadow over a deal to acquire Pringles from Procter & Gamble.
lead_paragraph: It appears that not even Diamond Foods knows what the future holds for its proposed acquisition of Procter & Gamble’s Pringles brand of chips. Behind the uncertainty of Diamond’s deal are competing narratives of a company that is either the victim of an attack by short-sellers or otherwise responsible for its own troubles.

headline.main: At Diamond Foods, Accounting Weighs on Pringles Deal
